reviewText:
shipped fast,works great,great price,top quality.. it is great to be able to order a product with confidence.
May the Lord continue to Bless!!
"Jesus Saves
I purchased this for one movie that was on it, but they are all great!  Great family time-your kids will love them.

I enjoyed each of the four movies,"Spirit Bear,Spirit of the Eagle,& The Song of Hiawatha,"I found outstanding. Sign of the Otter was,"ok,"But I did enjoy it. The British leaders seemed a bit not believeable,"A bit stupid at times. All in all I gave it five stars," I loved them.

I received these movies in good condition.  We are really anxious to watch the movies but usually watch them on the weekends.  I'm looking forward to watching all four of them, may all in one sitting with a bag of popcorn.  Sounds like a good movie night.

This has some very great stories based on early American culture, and life.
Great watching all of them, very enjoyable for the family.

Spirit Bear was great. Very interesting set in Vancouver based on a true story of a teen green activist. Hiawatha was interesting with good acting as usual from some wonderful First Nation - Native Canadian and Native American actors with seasoned chops trying to do well with a minimal script. Both the Dan Haggerty films Sign of the Otter and Spirit of the Eagle were mediocre and inauthentic. Although they had good Native American actors - all characters were stereotypes with no real depth or authenticity, especially the minimal acting by the non-Native actors. I would suggest just buying Spirit Bear on it's own, as well as Song of Hiawatha unless you on are a low budget then it may be cheaper to buy the set.
